releaseNotes: - (P.S. Wow we can't believe that it's been 3 months since the last update.)
- Updated time for caching API requests in `v1.6.0`'s release notes
- Cleared off the bugs with programming soap and water. Remember to wash your hands!
- Added support for caching requests from the `/res` subpath
- Updated MDI icons to use the [`@mdi/angular-material`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@mdi/angular-material) NPM library
- Added unit tests
- Under-the-hood improvements
- Increased social distancing by 150%
- Added support for purchasing digital toilet paper
- (For a full list of changes, view the diff between `v1.6.0` and this release [here](https://github.com/EdricChan03/rss-reader-angular/compare/v1.6.0...v1.6.1))
- Add support for caching API requests!
- API requests that return timely information (such as news or an RSS feed) will be cached up to an hour
- API requests that return non-timely information (such as country data) will be cached up to a week
- (Note: This is not final and may be changed in the future)
- We've spring-cleaned the app to bring in the New Year! What we've done so far:
- Improved updating functionality
- Removed no longer needed developer guides
- Removed unused devices page
- Improved GitHub repository README
- Updated license to 2020! ðŸŽ‰
- Shortened the dates on the releases page. No one wants such a detailed date anyway!
- Moar bug fixes!
- Tons of code refactoring!
- And other changes to the app's internals:
- [Internal] Added initial unit tests! Woohoo! (Although this should've been done way earlier)
- [Internal] Added support for specifying the status of a release, as well as any additional comments on the release.
- [Internal] The settings page is now lazy-loaded!
- [Internal] The releases page now uses the HTML `<time>` element for dates.
- [CI] Bring back support for unit testing
- [CI] Add step to cache node_modules and documentation
- [CI] Improve deploying
- Removed explore page as it wasn't that useful/too bare-bones.
- bUg FiXeS
- Minor code refactoring/restructuring
- Update links to social stuff
- That's all folks! Make sure you like and subscribe to... Wait, you mean we can't promote our social links here?
- Merry Christmas everyone!
- Yet another quickfix that reverses the way the current release notes are shown. (This reduces the need for scrolling to see the more recent release notes.)
- The release notes page now shows the current release notes on the top of the page. (So that you don't have to scroll down. :P)
- [Internal] Move release notes to a dedicated subdirectory. (Not much to see here for end-users, folks!)
- We. Need. More. Jokes. In. Release. Notes.
- We've introduced bugs and squashed them.
- We've also tried to remove as much jokes as possible - but to no avail. :shrug:
- Quickfix to fix the broken guide pages - they should be working now.
- There are no other changes, unless you count the change to create a new release for this change. :think:
- Fixed broken release notes page (You should be able to see the release notes now! Yay!)
- Use UTC dates instead of localised time internally. (Yay UTC! Better than localised time zones - and that dreaded DST thingy..)
- [Internal] Added support for arrays as release notes. (Yes! Much better.)
- Added more jokes to the release notes. (Gotta spice up the release notes, ya know?)
- That's about it really. No really, that's it.
- Unless you want more release notes? Or you can check out the site's source code revision history if you really want to.
- Removed settings that would not do anything
- Use labels instead of placeholders for input fields
- Added release notes that would inform you of the latest features
- Added tooltip to "more options" button in toolbar
- Slight tweaking of onboarding experience for new users
- And lots of bug-fixes!
